definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: He paid ten dollars for the new harness.
sentences.chinese: 他花十美元买了这件马具。

sentences.english: He harnessed the horse to a wagon.
He tackled the horse up for plowing.
sentences.chinese: 他给马套上马具去耕田。

sentences.english: Shall we go see about that harness?
sentences.chinese: 我们能去看看那个马具吗？

sentences.english: The harness was entangled with an object which blocked the way.
sentences.chinese: 马具也同挡在路上的什么东西缠在一起。

sentences.english: The old man glanced doggedly at his wife as he tightened the last buckles on the harness.
sentences.chinese: 当扣上马具上的最后一个扣子时，老人依然看着妻子。

sentences.english: The vet had improvised a harness.
sentences.chinese: 兽医临时凑成了一副马具。

sentences.english: As soon as the horses are harnessed up, the group will be ready to leave.
sentences.chinese: 等马一套上马具，全团就准备好可以出发了。
